column2: The cherry trees are blooming, and it would be a perfect time to invite your vassals to celebrate this.
This province was extensively decorated for a Hanami
Following the Buddhist faith instead of following the Shinto faith should not be a cause for strife amongst our people.
The formerly Shinto population of the county of [Root.GetName] has converted to the Buddhist faith.
The formerly Shinto population of the county of [From.GetName] has converted to the Buddhist faith.
The formerly Shinto population of the county of [Root.GetName] has converted to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
The formerly Shinto population of the county of [From.GetName] has converted to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
Before the invites for the hanami can be sent out you will need to make some preparations, seeing as it will require various things that your servants would not normally need to know to prepare.
While your guests will be staying in your court for some time during the hanami, you still need to decide whether the main event will take place during the day or the night. Which will it be?

During your preparations for the hanami, you have considered various forms of entertainment for your guests. One option would be to hire some shirabyoshi to entertain your guests. Do you wish to hire a few?
Your capital could use some embellishments during the hanami. The commoners would appreciate it, for one thing, and chances are the guests would like it too. Do you want to decorate the capital?
Some of the nearby Shinto shrines would doubtlessly appreciate it if you sent some offerings for the kami as part of the hanami celebrations. Do you want to do that?

Word has reached you that [From.GetBestName] is sending some offerings to a Shinto shrine in preparation for an upcoming hanami. You believe you have the opportunity to taint those offerings, should you wish to use it.
Your personal garden has seen better days, and with the guests having to spend time there to enjoy the cherry blossoms properly it might be a good idea to improve the garden. Do you wish to do so?
I know how to do that!
You will need to have food prepared for the hanami. The question is, how much are you willing to spend on the food?
With the preparations out of the way, it is time to invite your vassals to join you for the hanami.

[Root.GetTitledName], I hereby invite you to my upcoming hanami.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName], I have no interest in joining you for your hanami, and refuse to attend.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledName]

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [Root.Capital.GetName], and it looks like it will be a beautiful day. As your vassals arrive from both near and far, you look out across your garden with a smile on your face.\n\nHopefully, this will be a memorable occasion, and everyone will come away from it satisfied. If not, it is too late to do anything about it now. You wave over a nearby servant and give them a few quick instructions before you head down to greet one of the new arrivals.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [Root.Capital.GetName], and hundreds of paper lanterns hang amongst them to illuminate the night. As your vassals arrive from both near and far, you look out across your garden with a smile on your face.\n\nHopefully, this will be a memorable occasion, and everyone will come away from it satisfied, but there are a thousand things that could go wrong. Of course, it is a bit late to worry about that now, and you do your best to put it out of your mind as you head down to greet one of the recent arrivals.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [From.Capital.GetName] as your party arrives, and it looks like it will be a beautiful day. Your liege, [From.GetTitledName], has invited vassals from both near and far, and you see both familiar faces and faces you barely recognize.\n\nThe hanami should be a memorable occasion, and you hope that you will have a good time, along with everyone else. Doubtlessly, [From.GetTitledName] has prepared for every eventuality, as [From.GetSheHe] has a smile on [From.GetHerHis] face as [From.GetSheHe] greets you.

The cherry blossoms are in full bloom in [From.Capital.GetName] as your party arrives, and hundreds of paper lanterns hang amongst them to illuminate the night. Your liege, [From.GetTitledName], has invited vassals from both near and far, and you see both familiar faces and faces you barely recognize.\n\nThe hanami should be a memorable occasion, and you hope that everyone will have a good time. Given that [From.GetTitledName] seems unconcerned as [From.GetSheHe] greets you, there should be nothing to worry about.

[From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to extensively decorate [From.GetHerHis] capital for the hanami, and it truly is a sight to behold. Even if you ignore the cherry trees themselves, it is a most impressive display.

Your servants inform you that they have overheard [From.GetTitledName] speak with approval of the decorations you saw fit to hang up in your capital. Clearly, not only the commoners appreciate the display.

Aside from the cherry trees in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden and elsewhere, [From.Capital.GetName] is almost entirely without decorations. It seems [From.GetTitledName] cannot be bothered to show off [From.GetHerHis] wealth.

It would seem [From.GetTitledName] has expressed [From.GetHerHis] dislike of the lack of decorations in [Root.Capital.GetName] where people could overhear [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps you should have invested more in decorations.
Your liege, [From.GetTitledName], has seen fit to send some offerings to a nearby Shinto shrine as part of the hanami celebration, doubtlessly hoping that the kami will be pleased by this.
I should say that I approve...

Shortly after thanks arrived from the shrine you sent offerings to, [From.GetTitledName] took the time to add [From.GetHerHis] own thanks to those of the priests at the shrine. It would seem that [From.GetSheHe] was impressed by your generosity.
It would seem that [From.GetTitledName] has not seen fit to send a proper offering to the kami at a nearby shrine. The priests did not see fit to complain, but you could.

[From.GetTitledName] requested a word in private with you, and once you were away from the other guests [From.GetSheHe] angrily complained about the lack of a proper offering for the kami of a nearby shrine.

Your attempt to taint the offerings sent to a shrine as part of the hanami has been successful. The priests sent a messenger thanking you profusedly for the offerings, which now pollute the shrine with unholy energies.

A priest arrived today from the shrine you sent offerings to, informing you that the offerings seemed unclean and that the priests had decided not to present them to the kami. However, you do not seem to be under suspicion.
It would seem the priests at the shrine you sent some tainted offerings to are a suspicious lot. The sabotage was discovered, and now fingers are being pointed your way. Nothing can be proven, but...

Your tainting of the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine went well. The priests have sent word that they are thankful for the offerings, and clearly they are not suspecting that their shine has been befouled.

Your attempt to taint the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine did not pan out. The priests discovered that something was awry with the offerings right away, even if your involvement does not seem to be suspected.

Word has reached you from the shrine you sent some offerings to that someone has attempted to pollute them. The priests are convinced that you are not to blame, but they cannot determine whose fault it is.

You attempted to taint the offerings [FromFrom.GetTitledName] sent to the kami at a nearby shrine, but this has turned out poorly. There is no proof, but you have heard whispers suggesting your involvement, and perhaps someone will believe them...

The hanami at [From.GetTitledName]'s capital is mainly taking place beneath the cherry trees in the garden. You have seen well-tended gardens in the past, but the garden of [From.GetTitledName] is one of the best you have encountered.

[From.GetTitledName] appears to be awestruck at the state of your garden, and has been heard praising the work that has been done there in preparation for the hanami. Evidently, you made the right decision to improve it.

While the cherry trees in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden are in full bloom, the effect is somewhat diminished by the poor state of the garden as a whole. It seems [From.GetTitledName] does not care about tending it at all.

You did not put a lot of effort into improving your garden before the start of the hanami, and [From.GetTitledName] appears to be horrified at the state of it as [From.GetSheHe] has been heard loudly complaining about it.

While [From.GetTitledName] has prepared some diversions during the hanami, [From.GetSheHe] does not appear to have seen fit to hire any entertainers despite it being a perfect occasion to bring out some shirabyoshi to entertain everyone present.

[From.GetTitledName] has been complaining loudly about the lack of shirabyoshi where all of the guests could overhear [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps you should have paid for some entertainment to avoid upsetting [From.GetHerHim] and everyone else.

The shirabyoshi you hired to entertain your guests did not show up on time, and as more and more time passes you slowly realize that they probably are not coming. Given that they have not seen fit to send an explanation, they have probably made a run for it.

[From.GetTitledName] has been claiming that there would be shirabyoshi entertaining the guests at some point during the hanami, but they never make an appearance, and [From.GetTitledName] offers no explanation for it.

The shirabyoshi you hired show up on time and start to entertain the guests with their music and dancing. However, you quickly realize that they are not particularly skilled in their chosen field, and the entertainment is not particularly enjoyable.
[From.GetTitledName] has hired some shirabyoshi to entertain everyone at the hanami, but they are not particularly good as their songs are off-key and their dancing is uncoordinated at best.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledName], has hired some shirabyoshi to perform at [From.GetHerHis] hanami, and you find their entertainment inspiring. You get the opportunity to approach them to ask for advice on a certain skill.

It seems your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetBestName] has been inspired by the shirabyoshi you hired and has learned from them after talking with them for a while. Hopefully, this will be an advantage in the future!

As you take a walk amongst the cherry trees on your own, you come across [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. You have always been curious about whether the shirabyoshi know how to use the sword they wear, and when you inquire about it [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] suggests a duel to find out.

[From.GetTitledName] has approached you and let you know that [From.GetSheHe] and [troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] are planning to duel one another as [From.GetTitledName] wants to know if the shirabyoshi can fight or not.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledName], has refused your request to duel [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], claiming that that is not the kind of entertainment [From.GetSheHe] hired the shirabyoshi to perform.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] were apparently planning to fight a duel to find out if the latter only carries a sword for show or if she actually knows how to use it, but it would seem [From.GetTitledName] has forbidden it.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledName], has approved your request to duel [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi.GetBestName]. As the final preparations are being made, you need to determine how you will approach the duel.
[From.GetTitledName] will soon be fighting you in a duel to find out if you can fight or if your sword is just for show. How do you want to approach the duel?

It seems [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.troublesome_shirabyoshi] will soon be fighting a duel, supposedly because [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is curious about whether shirabyoshi know how to fight. Perhaps it will be for show, or perhaps the two combatants will try to kill one another.

The duel between you and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] isn not over in an instant, but you gain the upper hand relatively quickly and keep the pressure up until you can manage to disarm the shirabyoshi.\n\n"The fight is yours, my [Root.GetLordLady]," she says, bowing her head.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. Surprisingly enough, [From.GetTitledName] still seemed convinced that [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] was a competent fighter, complimenting her for putting up a good fight.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. However, instead of being a good winner, [From.GetTitledName] decided to mock the shirabyoshi for thinking that she had a chance in the first place.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. It seems as if the shirabyoshi impressed [FromFrom.GetTitledName], though, since [FromFrom.GetSheHe] saw fit to compliment her skills after the duel was over.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. Upon disarming the shirabyoshi, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] saw fit to be a poor winner and mocked the shirabyoshi for challenging [FromFrom.GetHerHim] in the first place.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] was a bit more drawn out than expected, but eventually [From.GetTitledName] prevailed. However, apparently simply disarming the shirabyoshi was not good enough for [From.GetTitledName], as [From.GetSheHe] decided to strike down the unarmed woman.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] managed to win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], even if it was not a quick victory. The shirabyoshi surrendered upon losing her sword, but [FromFrom.GetTitledName] did not see fit to let her live and struck her down.

Your duel against [FromFrom.GetBestName] goes on for quite some time with neither of you getting the upper hand, and eventually [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName] declares it a draw. Are you prepared to admit that the shirabyoshi was quite good, or will you claim you held back?

[From.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel went on for a considerable amount of time without either party getting the upper hand, and eventually you had to declare it a draw. Surprisingly, [From.GetTitledName] saluted the shirabyoshi and praised her skills.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel was indecisive, and [From.GetTitledName] eventually had to call it a draw. Surprisingly enough, this outcome appears to have been acceptable for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] saluted the shirabyoshi at the end.

[From.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel went on for a considerable amount of time without either party getting the upper hand, and eventually you had to declare it a draw. [From.GetTitledName] loudly claimed that [From.GetSheHe] held back as [From.GetSheHe] sheathed [From.GetHerHis] sword.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName]'s duel was indecisive, and [From.GetTitledName] eventually had to call it a draw. As [FromFrom.GetSheHe] sheathed [FromFrom.GetHerHis] sword, [FromFrom.GetSheHe] loudly claimed that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] was holding back.

Your duel against [From.GetTitledName] is not completely one-sided, but you gain the upper hand eventually and manage to disarm [From.GetHerHim]. You could demand [From.GetHerHis] surrender at this point, or just strike [From.GetHerHim] down where [From.GetSheHe] stands.

Your duel against [FromFrom.GetBestName] does not go well. It is not entirely one-sided, but eventually the shirabyoshi prevails and manages to disarm you, and you are forced to yield. You might be able to claim that you did not fight at your full potential, should you wish to.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] wasn not particularly even, and eventually the shirabyoshi triumphed. Surprisingly enough, [From.GetTitledName] did not seem to have an hard feelings towards [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], and instead praised her skills.

[From.GetTitledName] did not prevail in [From.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]. However, instead of trying to save face, [From.GetTitledName] decided to praise the shirabyoshi's skills after the fight was over, which seemed to please her.

[From.GetTitledName]'s duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] was not particularly even, and eventually the shirabyoshi triumphed. As the shirabyoshi walked away, [From.GetTitledName] loudly proclaimed that [From.GetSheHe] was holding back the whole time.

[From.GetTitledName] did not prevail in [From.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]. As the shirabyoshi sheathed her sword and started to walk away, [From.GetTitledName] started to claim that [From.GetSheHe] was holding back the whole time.

Your duel against [FromFrom.GetBestName] does not go well. It is not entirely one-sided, but eventually the shirabyoshi prevails and manages to disarm you. Before you have the chance to yield, she raises her sword again and cuts you down.

[FromFrom.GetBestName] managed to prevail against [From.GetTitledName] in their duel, and the shirabyoshi is not content with simply beating her opponent. Before [From.GetTitledName] manages to surrender, [From.GetSheHe] is cut down by [FromFrom.GetBestName].

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] did not win [FromFrom.GetHerHis] duel against [FromFromFrom.GetBestName], and the shirabyoshi is completely merciless on victory, striking [FromFrom.GetTitledName] down where [FromFrom.GetSheHe] stands.

Amongst the shirabyoshi you hired, [remarkable_shirabyoshi.GetBestName] truly stands out as exceptional, and she offers to stay at your court after the hanami is over. This is too good an opportunity to turn down.
Stay as long as you like!

One of the shirabyoshi [From.GetTitledName] hired, [From.remarkable_shirabyoshi.GetBestName], has proven to be a far better performer than the average shirabyoshi, and you are not surprised when you learn that she will become a permanent member of [From.GetTitledName]'s court.

There is always a risk that the weather will be bad during the day of the hanami, which can ruin the experience, but the weather could not have been better this time, and everyone can fully enjoy the festivities.
You have had some fun spending time with [From.hanami_friend_2.GetBestName] at [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami. Perhaps you should become friends.

[From.GetBestName] appears to like your company at [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s hanami, and you also enjoy their company. It comes as no surprise when [From.GetBestName] suggests the two of you should become friends.
[From.GetBestName] seems to have enjoyed your company too, as [From.GetSheHe] is happy to declare you [From.GetHerHis] friend. Surely, this is the start of many great things!
It would seem [From.GetBestName] has not enjoyed your company as much as you have enjoyed spending thime with [From.GetHerHim], as [From.GetSheHe] claims to have no interest to become your friend.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami [From.hanami_rival_2.GetBestName] has been extremely poor company, and you cannot help but to feel insulted by the way they speak to you. Do you intend to demand an apology?

[From.GetBestName] appears to have taken some things you have said during [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s personally, and [From.GetSheHe] has demanded that you apologize for the things you have said. Is this something you want to do?
[From.GetBestName] refused to apologize to you, and doubled down on [From.GetHerHis] insults towards you. It is clear that this is the start of a rivalry between the two of you.
[From.GetBestName] apparently did not mean the things [From.GetSheHe] said and has apologized over the insults, seemingly sincerely sorry to have offended you.

During the hanami, you come across [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] loudly arguing with one another. You cannot tell what the reason for their quarrel is, but perhaps you could try to smooth things over.

It seems your attempt to smooth things over has been successful, for [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] quickly calm down and are conversing as friends again by the time you are walking away from them.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami, you and another vassal ended up arguing with one another. Luckily, [From.GetTitledName] managed to clear up the misunderstanding and you now know that there was no reason to get angry with anyone.

Your attempt to meddle in the argument between [arguing_hanami_vassal_1.GetBestName] and [arguing_hanami_vassal_2.GetBestName] did not go well, and they are now angry with both you and one another. Perhaps it would have been better if you had not meddled.

During [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami, you and another vassal ended up arguing with one another. [From.GetTitledName] apparently thought that [From.GetSheHe] could be a diplomat and clear things up, but [From.GetSheHe] only made things worse.
A priestess from a nearby shrine made an unexpected appearance at your hanami, offering to say a few words and to make a small offering to the kami in your name after you welcomed her to the hanami.

As [From.GetTitledName]'s hanami continues, you find yourself talking to [From.hanami_lover_2.GetBestName], a very lovely [From.hanami_lover_2.GetManWoman]. You cannot tell for sure, but they might be interested in you in a romantic way, and it would be easy to slip away into the night with them if they agree to it...

You have been talking to [From.GetBestName] for quite some time at [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s hanami and think that they are a fine [From.GetManWoman]. It does not surprise you particularly much when [From.GetSheHe] suggests that the two of you should find someplace private to get to know one another more closely.

[From.GetBestName] did not seem to appreciate your attempt to get to know them intimately, and [From.GetSheHe] hastily ended your conversation and hurried away. Hopefully, they will not speak of your suggestion with anyone else.

[From.GetBestName] was amenable to your suggestion to slip away into the darkness to get to know one another intimately, and it is not long before you find a secluded part of [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName]'s garden and start to get undressed.
It is good to be the [Root.GetTitle]!

You have taken a short break from the festivities and are taking a walk through a secluded part of your garden when you hear a sound from behind some bushes. You go around them and find [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] entwined with one another, neither of them wearing any clothes.
[From.GetTitledName] stumbled upon you and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] in a compromising position, but it appears that [From.GetSheHe] is content to keep it secret, at least for now.
[From.GetTitledName] stumbled upon you and [FromFrom.GetBestName] in a compromising position, but it appears that [From.GetSheHe] is content to keep it secret, at least for now.

[From.GetTitledName] discovered you and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] together in a compromising position. Before either of you can speak, [From.GetTitledName] asks you what [From.GetHerHis] silence is worth to you.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] discovered you and [From.GetBestName] together in a compromising position. Before either of you can speak, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] asks you what [FromFrom.GetHerHis] silence is worth to you.
Both [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] agreed to pay you off to keep their tryst secret without any complaints.
I will keep it secret, then!

You could not get [hanami_lover_1.GetBestName] and [hanami_lover_2.GetBestName] to agree to any concessions in exchange for your silence, and this leaves you no option but to expose their tryst to everyone at the hanami.
[From.GetTitledName] has outed your tryst to everyone at the hanami, and since there is no possible way for you to attempt to cover up the situation the scandal is a fact.

[From.GetTitledName] somehow caught wind of the fact that [FromFrom.GetBestName] and [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] were sleeping together, and has outed their relationship to everyone at the hanami. Given that the two were discovered together in a state of undress, there is no plausible alternative explanation.
It seems the sounds from your hanami carries well beyond your garden, for some of the townspeople have sent a message asking you to try to quiet things down a bit so that they can sleep properly.

In the middle of the night, you can see something moving about in the darkness just at the edge of your vision. You cannot tell who or what it is, and it might just be your mind playing tricks on you, but that is not certain...

As the hanami continues, you find [sleeping_hanami_vassal.GetBestName] asleep in a somewhat secluded part of your garden. The temptation to draw something on [sleeping_hanami_vassal.GetHerHis] face is almost impossible to overcome.

You accidentally fell asleep during the hanami in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden since you slept poorly the night before. When you wake up, you hear the sound of laughter, and it does not take you long to discover that someone has drawn something inappropriate on your face.

You accidentally fell asleep during the hanami in [From.GetTitledName]'s garden since you slept poorly the night before. Before long, you wake up to discover that [From.GetTitledName] is trying to draw something on your face.

[From.GetBestName] wakes up as you are drawing on their face and angrily demand that you stop. It would seem [From.GetSheHe] was not as soundly asleep as you had thought that [From.GetSheHe] was, or that you are considerably less stealthy than you thought.
You have made sure that there is plenty of sake for the guests at your hanami, and know for sure that there is enough to go around even if you have some. Surely there is no harm in drinking some?
The cherry blossoms at the hanami are certainly inspiring, and you find yourself in the mood for writing some poetry. Perhaps you should challenge [From.GetTitledName] to a poetry contest?
[From.GetTitledName] appears to feel inspired by the cherry blossoms and has suggested that the two of you compete with one another in a poetry contest. Do you agree to the proposal?
It would seem [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in poetry, for [From.GetSheHe] turned down your suggested poetry contest right away and suggested that [From.GetSheHe] had better things to do.
After you and your opponent have written your poems, you hand them over to some of the other guests to read so that they may choose a winner. After some deliberation, they decide that you have won.
After you and your opponent have written your poems, you hand them over to some of the other guests to read so that they may choose a winner. After some deliberation, they decide that you have lost.
[From.hanami_duel_vassal_2.GetBestName] has insulted you during the hanami, and it would be well within your rights to challenge them to a duel. Do you wish to do so?
Apparently, [From.GetBestName] feels that you have insulted [From.GetHerHim] at the hanami, and [From.GetSheHe] is now challenging you to a duel. However, if you apologize, the duel could be avoided.
It appears [From.GetBestName] does not wish to fight you, as [From.GetSheHe] instead has apologized for upsetting you. Perhaps it is for the best to let the matter rest.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, [From.GetTitledName] has triumphed.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, neither came out ahead in the duel.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has triumphed.
You and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and you quickly get the upper hand. Before long, they are disarmed.
You and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, but it becomes clear that neither of you can get the upper hand.
You and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and they quickly get the upper hand. Before long, you are disarmed.
You and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and they quickly get the upper hand. Before long, you are disarmed.
You and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, but it becomes clear that neither of you can get the upper hand.
You and [From.GetTitledName] fight one another for some time, and you quickly get the upper hand. Before long, they are disarmed.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, [From.GetTitledName] has triumphed.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, neither came out ahead in the duel.

It seems [From.GetBestName] and [FromFrom.GetBestName] have quarreled during the hanami and that only a duel could settle the matter. Whether there were other options or not, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has triumphed.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several truly magnificient meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several decent meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
[From.GetTitledName] has has several very plain meals prepared for the hanami. Doubtlessly, [From.GetSheHe] would like to hear if [From.GetHerHis] guests liked the food.
